toc_entry.title: The Sweet Song of Justice
toc_entry.description: The verdict is in, but a complete account of what went on in the Selena m urder trial hasn’t come out—until now.

toc_entry.title: The Last Picture Shows
toc_entry.description: A loving look back at nine grand old movie houses from the golden age of small-town Texas.
toc_entry.byline: by anne Dingus * Photographs by Dan Winters

toc_entry.title: Carrillo’s Crossing
toc_entry.description: In the bloody billion-dollar business of drug trafficking, amado Carrillo Fuentes is king. He is the elusive ringleader of a smuggling operation that police on both sides of the border are powerless to stop.

toc_entry.title: Sorry, Charlie
toc_entry.description: The last of the LBJ-style Democracts, the rowdy and reckless Ch arlie Wilson has called it quits. A fond farewell.

toc_entry.title: Down and Out
toc_entry.description: My firsthand experience with the hard times that humbled my hero, former Dallas Cowboys star Golden Richards.

toc_entry.title: Cook Your Goose!
toc_entry.description: Turn your holiday dinner into a mouth-watering master-feast with these new recipes from Star Canyon chef Stephan Pyles.

toc_entry.title: We are the World
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: An ambitious new exhibit at the Museum of Fine arts, Houston suggests Texas is becoming less like itself and more like everyplace else.

toc_entry.title: Doubting Thomas
toc_entry.subtitle: Television
toc_entry.description: Leaving the popular sitcom Wings for his own show on the Fox network seemed like a risky move, but it’s paying off for native Texan Thomas Haden Church—so far.

toc_entry.title: A Whale of a Tale
toc_entry.subtitle: Travel
toc_entry.description: In a remote Mexican bay, you can touch a forty-ton gray, watch her lovely, enormous baby rub playfully against your boat, and ponder the mysteries of the natural world.

toc_entry.title: The Good Old Boy
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: After four decades of writing classic Texas novels, there’s no denying that San angelo’s Elmer Kelton has earned his Spurs.

toc_entry.title: Home, Sweet Homestead
toc_entry.subtitle: Shopping
toc_entry.description: Five chic interior design stores in Fredericksburg are comforting, inspiring, and for the acquisitive, absolutely irresistible.

toc_entry.title: The Pickup Basketball Diaries
toc_entry.subtitle: Sports
toc_entry.description: It has its own language, a distinct culture, and codes and standards that transcend race and national identity. Plus it’s exhilarating—even in the Texas heat.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: Why are so many students in Texas unable to read? The answer is obvious: because the school system has failed them.

toc_entry.title: Roar of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Forget Buddy Holly? That’ll be the day. Plus: Boone Pickens’ hellish fight, Norma McCorvey’s heavenly conversion.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Inspired by the O. J. Simpson case, Texas has taken the lead in fighting domestic violence. Plus: Where Microsoft wants to go today; the myth of the NAFTA superhighway; a cyberpunk writer’s sterling career; and bullets over Broadway at the Granbury Opera House.

toc_entry.title: around the State
toc_entry.description: Dancin’, as it were, at anson’s Pioneer Hall. Plus: Tina Modotti’s passionate photography in Houston; major league mariachis in San antonio; and Ebenezer Scrooge in Galveston.
toc_entry.byline: Edited by Quita McMath, Erin Gromen, and Cheri Ballew

toc_entry.title: State Fare
toc_entry.description: The bread pudding at Houston’s Redwood Grill is a dauntingly rich and absolutely delicious treat—so get your just desserts.

toc_entry.title: Restaurant Guide
toc_entry.byline: Edited by Patricia Sharpe and anne Dingus

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Budget cuts are coming. Are teaching hospitals DOA? Plus: are white Democrats MIA?
